code:
def is_prime?(n)
  return false if n < 2
  (2..Math.sqrt(n)).each do |i|
    return false if n % i == 0
  end
  true
end

# Example usage:
# is_prime?(7)  # => true
# is_prime?(10) # => false
final_answer(answer: "def is_prime?(n)\n  return false if n < 2\n  (2..Math.sqrt(n)).each do |i|\n    return false if n % i == 0\n  end\n  true\nend")
raw_response:
Thought: Write a Ruby function that determines whether a given integer is prime and then return its source code as the answer.  
```ruby
def is_prime?(n)
  return false if n < 2
  (2..Math.sqrt(n)).each do |i|
    return false if n % i == 0
  end
  true
end

# Example usage:
# is_prime?(7)  # => true
# is_prime?(10) # => false
final_answer(answer: "def is_prime?(n)\n  return false if n < 2\n  (2..Math.sqrt(n)).each do |i|\n    return false if n % i == 0\n  end\n  true\nend")
```
